text.0: ye who observe this day be with us even thrice farstretching is you bounty aśvins and your course.
text.1: to you as to a cloak in winter we cleave close you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise.
text.2: three are the fellies in your honeybearing car that travels after somas loved one as all know.
text.3: three are the pillars set upon it for support thrice journey ye by night o aśvins thrice by day.
text.4: thrice in the selfsame day ye gods who banish want sprinkle ye thrice today our sacrifice with meath.
text.5: and thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength at evening o ye aśvins and at break of day.
text.6: thrice come ye to our home thrice to the righteous folk thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help.
text.7: thrice o ye aśvins bring us what shall make us glad thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail.
text.8: thrice o ye aśvins bring to us abundant wealth thrice in the gods assembly thrice assist our thoughts.
text.9: thrice grant ye us prosperity thrice grant us fame for the suns daughter hath mounted your threewheeled car.
text.10: thrice aśvins grant to us the heavenly medicines thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold.
text.11: favour and health and strength bestow upon my son triple protection lords of splendour grant to him.
text.12: thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us thrice o ye aśvins ye travel around the earth.
text.13: carborne from far away o ye nāsatyas come like vital air to bodies come ye to the three.
text.14: thrice o ye aśvins with the seven mother streams three are the jars the triple offering is prepared.
text.15: three are the worlds and moving on above the sky ye guard the firmset vault of heaven through days and nights.
text.16: where are the three wheels of your triple chariot where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened.
text.17: when will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it to bring you to our sacrifice nāsatyas.
text.18: nāsatyas come the sacred gift is offered up drink the sweet juice with lips that know the sweetness well.
text.19: savitar sends before the dawn of day your car fraught with oil variouscoloured to our sacrifice.
text.20: come o nāsatyas with the thriceeleven gods come o ye aśvins to the drinking of the meath.
text.21: make long our days of life and wipe out all our sins ward off our enemies be with us evermore.
text.22: borne in your triple car o aśvins bring us present prosperity with noble offspring.
text.23: i cry to you who hear me for protection be ye our helpers where men win the booty.
